author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 10
text:
Number of the day
$2.5 trillion 
That’s how much equity global stocks added this week, one of the best weekly surges since 2011. Stocks, commodities and emerging-market currencies all extended a rally. The Standard & Poor’s 500 Index’s advance this week was its best of the year, leaving it at the highest point since Aug. 20. 
In case you
missed it 
Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo is now playing consultant to the cast of the HBO show “Silicon Valley.” The network told the Hollywood Reporter that Costolo, a former stand-up comedian, reportedly spends a few days a week in the writers’ room, weighing in on topics like VC funds, startups and (ahem) fired executives.
D’oh!
After leaving users panicked and locked out of their own files for about two hours on Friday, Google Drive began functioning again around 2 p.m. — just in time for everyone on the East Coast to give up and go home for the weekend. At its peak, technology monitoring site Down Detector reported nearly 12,000 reports from Google users. Google has not confirmed what caused the outage or how the system was reconnected. Thousands took to Twitter to implore the Internet, “Is it just me?!” It wasn’t.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
